channel.title: Steve Jobs has 6 weeks to live

item.title: Steve Jobs has 6 weeks to live
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

Ollie:

No one can deny he is a clever bloke, even when people say they “hate” apple products, its extremely biased, thats because they have never owned one before.

I have owned a few (give to me) they suck.

Read full topic
item.source: Steve Jobs has 6 weeks to live

item.title: Steve Jobs has 6 weeks to live
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Thug-life:

And not many people deny the price isn’t great. But we’ll stomach it to use something we enjoy and like using.

Yeah people can’t believe me when I tell them my ipod touch came to $360 with the tax. irl and online, I am told I should have gotten something cheaper. I’ve used many different kinds, but I chose the ipod touch because I fell in love with it. It’s the most user friendly I’ve ever used, which is why it was perfect for my car stereo system.

$360 was A LOT. But I got what I wanted.

Read full topic

item.title: Steve Jobs has 6 weeks to live
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“akl, post:19, topic:383231”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=479012.msg3509712#msg3509712 date=1298463148]

He has done stuff for charities etc., as much as I don’t like the guy its not like he JUST sits on piles of cash. I think its a bit unfair to outright say “hes not a philanthropist like Gates”.
[/quote]He is still a douche though. Don’t forget the multiple occasions where he has lied to his comrades (Wozniak included) to keep more money to himself.

Where did he do that?
can you post a source, I’d like to read up on that…[/quote]http://www.woz.org/letters/general/91.html

Read full topic

item.title: Steve Jobs has 6 weeks to live
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

zachera:

Woz got amnesia from a plane crash, which is why he was booted from the company. He then chose not to return. Good choice, Woz.

Woz is still technically an employee at Apple, as an engineer

Though, he says it is only a few hundred dollars a month - he had his shares in Apple and the other stuff he invests in that makes him his money to do nothing. Go look up Steve Wozniak on The Engadget Show, he is epic.

Read full topic
item.source: Steve Jobs has 6 weeks to live

item.title: Steve Jobs has 6 weeks to live
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

I read wozniak’s autobiography, and it said he gets paid like a standard engineer wage, just to go round doing talks and stuff every now and then. That would be awesome, invent something leave the company but get paid enough of a wage each year to live a relatively normal life. He could just chill and smoke weed all day, serious business.

Steve jobs ofcourse only smokes like 1 joint a day

Read full topic

item.title: Steve Jobs has 6 weeks to live
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

I dunno. He returned to Apple in 1997 when they were “90 days from bankruptcy”. They are now the third most valuable company in the world.

Maybe he isn’t the most technically involved person at the company anymore. But his philosophy that he has forced upon his Apple has been seen through the products and they’ve been the ones that have put Apple in the position they are today.

Steve Wozniak is amazing though.

Read full topic
item.source: Steve Jobs has 6 weeks to live

item.title: Steve Jobs has 6 weeks to live
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

I’ve never understood the big deal about Steve Jobs.

He helped create a massively successful company, but he did it out of his friends invention, Steve Wozniak’s Apple II and it was Wozniak that remained an Engineer, refusing to be a CEO or anything, making him the hero, IMO.

Obviously it’s a pity if he is going to die, and he certainly is an intelligent man, but he seems just to be a people person, simply knowing how to best gain popularity. He’s no philanthropist, like Bill Gate’s either.

Read full topic
item.source: Steve Jobs has 6 weeks to live
